explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Liquid at a test temperature, 55degC. Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: After 2000mg/kg single time oral administration, no rats died and no expressed systemic toxicity. In addition, there was description that LD50 > 2000mg/kg (EU-RAR, 2003), it was considered as out of category.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on rat LC50 (2 hours): 98662ppm (4 hour equivalent: 205.45mg/L (EU-RAR, 2003)), this concentration suggest vapor with almost no mist from its vapor pressure. So it was classified as out of Category.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It is described that there is stimulativeness, such as a pain, burning sensation, and a blister, by skin application as a volunteer (test conditions, such as dosage, were unknown) (ACGIH (7th, 2001)). But from description that there was no stimulativeness to the human skin by the 24-hour patch test in the humans (EU-RAR (2003)), and that there was no stimulativeness in practice by the skin irritation study in a rabbit (the erythema and dropsy with the average values of Draize score of 0.67), it was set as the outside of Category.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: In the eye irritation tests with the rabbits, transient conjunctivitis was admitted, however, it recovered within 72 hours (EU-RAR (2003)). So we classfied it as Category 2B also based on the other descriptions.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Not classified
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory organ: No data. Skin: Since it was indicated that there was no sensitizing property in the Maximisation Test using the guinea pigs in EU-RAR (2003), we classified it as Out Of Category.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Since it was negative in the micronucleus test which used the rat myeloid cells of in vivo (EU-RAR, 2003), it carried out the outside of Category.

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: There is no data of the reproductive examination using laboratory animals. However, in the 13-week repetition inhalation exposure examination using rats, the effects of administration of a substance is not observed grossly and histologically in genital tract of male and female rats in the highest exposure concentration group (20000mg/m3, 6 hours/day) (EU-RAR, 2003). Moreover, there is a description that no influence on dam and fetus was observed in the teratogenicity test by oral administration using rats, even at the highest dose of 1000mg/kg/day (EU-RAR, 2003). Therefore, it was out of the Category.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause respiratory irritation or may cause drowsiness and dizziness (narcotic effects, respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Because of a description in ACGIH (7th, 2001) referring to that there were anesthetic actions and respiratory irritant through inhalation exposure to laboratory animals, and of descriptions in ACGIH (7th, 2001), EU-RAR (2003), Patty (4th, 1994), and Japan Society for Occupational Health recommendation (1993) referring to that there were respiratory irritant and anesthetic actions through inhalation exposure to mice. So it was judged as Category 3 (anesthetic actions, respiratory irritant).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: In the repetitive inhalation exposure test on rats (highest exposure concentrations: 6660ppm- 6 hours/day, 5 days/week for 13 weeks and 3000 ppm- 9 hours/day, 5 days/week for 30 weeks) (EU-RAR (2003)), and 16-week repeatitive inhalation exposure test on rats (the highest exposure concentrations : 3000 ppm, 12 hours/day, 7 days/week) (EU-RAR (2003), Patty (4th, 1994), and industrial hygiene society advice (1993)), it was observed no toxicity even with the highest exposure concentrations exceeding the guidance value for Category 2, and in long-term repetitive exposure of high concentration n-pentane on humans, it was reported to have no effects on central nervous systems (EU-RAR (2003)), therefore, it was classified as out of Category.

aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: May be fatal if swallowed and enters airways
aspiration_hazard.rationale: Since it is a hydrocarbon and the dynamic viscosity is 0.374mm2/s at 20 degrees C (calculated from the viscosity 0.234mPs-s, and the density of 0.62624g/cm3 at 20 degrees C), we classified it as Category 1.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 48-hour EC50=2.7mg/L of Crustacea (Daphnia magna) (EU-RAR, 2003).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since rapidly degrading (BOD: 96% (existing chemical safety inspections data)), and less bio-accumulative (log Kow=3.39 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).
